events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision on April 9th involving their car hitting a guardrail on the highway during heavy rain.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to keywords found in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to guide the claimant through the process and gather necessary information.
Acknowledgment sent to the customer confirming the receipt of their auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
Request for police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and witness statements was sent to the claimant.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report, vehicle photos, and a detailed accident description.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and assessing the damage to the vehicle involved in the accident.
Investigation completed with confirmation of liability and damage estimation finalized after vehicle inspection.
A settlement offer was made to the customer covering repair costs, rental car reimbursement, and minor medical expenses.
Client responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the timely handling of their claim.
The claim was formally approved after acceptance of the settlement by the customer with all conditions met.
Payment for the approved amount was issued to the claimantâ€™s bank account to cover all agreed expenses.
The insurance claim was officially closed after all payments were processed and customer confirmed no further issues.
